result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark W. Nelson

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:42 a.m. 
INCLUDES 19CM2132, 20CF360, 20CM198, 22CF596, 22CF677.
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

19CM2132>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Operating While Revoked); COURT grants. 

20CF360>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT grants. 

20CM198>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-TRO/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT grants. 

22CF596>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 
Count 6 (Disorderly Conduct); COURT grants. 

22CF677>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

20CF360>>
Count 1 (Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  
Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct/Repeater/DA Repeater/DA):  NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on each count: SWH for 3 years probation. 

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program intake assessment and successful completion.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School/Daycare or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  No contact with D.P.W. unless as approved by agent.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings.  90 hours community service I/S to be used for rule violations.  90 days MCJ I/S to be used for rule violations.   COURT grants 2 days credit.  

Probation review hearing>>10/07/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  10:00 a.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
